(0777) Read, write, and execute permissi: (0777) Read, write, and execute permissions for all users.

(0666) Read and write permissions for al: (0666) Read and write permissions for all users. No execute permissions for others.

Rollout policies allow you to control th: Rollout policies allow you to control the order of updates for the fleet devices.
Disruption budget allows you to limit th: Disruption budget allows you to limit the number of similar devices that may be updating simultaneously.
All the devices that are part of this fl: All the devices that are part of this fleet will receive updates as soon as they are available.
The disruption budget will be applied to: The disruption budget will be applied to all group combinations independently.
Use only the 'key' part of the labels to: Use only the 'key' part of the labels to group same values.
Leaving this empty will apply the disrup: Leaving this empty will apply the disruption budget to all fleet's devices.
At least this number of devices will be: At least this number of devices will be available at any given moment, for each group defined above.
No more than this number of devices will: No more than this number of devices will be unavailable at any given moment, for each group defined above.
The minimum percentage of devices that m: The minimum percentage of devices that must be updated successfully in order to continue updating the next batch of devices.
% of the batch devices pass the success: % of the batch devices pass the success threshold, move to next batch or the rest of fleet's devices.
Batches will be applied from first to la: Batches will be applied from first to last.
Devices that are not part of any batch w: Devices that are not part of any batch will be updated last.
The time-frame within which a device mus: The time-frame within which a device must be updated. If it exceeds it, device will be counted as a 'failed to update' in the batch success threshold.
Timeout devices that fail to update afte: Timeout devices that fail to update after
Time frame during which devices can star: Time frame during which devices can start downloading their new configurations.
Time frame during which devices can start downloading and installing their new configurations.
Time frame during which devices can start installing their new configurations.
Use different update schedules for downl: Use different update schedules for downloading and installing updates
<0>{fleetId}</0> will be deleted permane: <0>{fleetId}</0> will be deleted permanently. If the device selector of a remaining fleet matches a device in <2>{fleetId}</2>, the device will be moved to the new fleet. If there's no matching fleet for a device, it will be unlinked from any fleet.

Fleets make it easier to manage multiple: Fleets make it easier to manage multiple devices with shared configurations.
Fleets allow you to edit and update your: Fleets allow you to edit and update your devices at once.
To get started, create a new fleet or im: To get started, create a new fleet or import an existing configuration.
A resource sync is an automated Gitops m: A resource sync is an automated Gitops method that helps manage your imported fleets by monitoring source repository changes and updating your fleet configuration accordingly.
Fleets will appear in the fleets table l: Fleets will appear in the fleets table list and their status will be reflecting the resource sync process status. After a few minutes, they should be synced and enabled.

{{brand}} is waiting for the device to c: {{brand}} is waiting for the device to connect and report its status. It will report a ʼPending syncʼ status until it is able to reconnect. If it has configuration conflicts, it will report a ʼSuspendedʼ status and require manual action to resume.
{{brand}} is waiting for devices to conn: {{brand}} is waiting for devices to connect and report their status. Devices will report a ʼPending syncʼ status until they are able to connect. Devices with configuration conflicts will report a ʼSuspendedʼ status and require manual action to resume.
